blocks.value: Saint Jude Thaddeus, also called Judas (not Iscariot), is one of the twelve apostles. He is the patron saint of desperate cases and lost causes, invoked when all other help seems impossible.
His Question at the Last Supper

At the Last Supper, Thaddeus asked Jesus: 'Lord, how is it that you will manifest yourself to us, and not to the world?' Jesus answered by speaking of the love between the Father, Son, and believers (John 14:22-23).

Thaddeus wrote the Epistle of Jude, warning against false teachers and urging believers to 'contend for the faith.' Tradition says he preached in Judea, Samaria, Mesopotamia, and Persia, where he was martyred alongside Simon the Zealot.
